data.title: Best local Brewery in town!
data.text: This place has excellent beers and food, #1 Brewery in town, in my opinion. Great prices as well! 2 locations in town, South location does offer a  brunch which is dynamite! Beer sure to try out the beer cheese soup and Willie fillies (old recipe, not new)... Aka deep fried dill pickles, amazing!

data.title: Just Plain Poor Everything
data.text: Two of us stopped in for a quick drink and to check out the football games over the weekend of November 5-6.  Service was very lacking.  Finally able to order a bite to eat and a drink for each of us.  The food arrived well before the drinks and the drinks came out separately and slowly.  I ordered a Bloody Mary - nothing extraordinary - at least you wouldn't think.  When it finally showed up, I attempted to stir it with the "celery" but when I picked up that celery item, it literally drooped over my hand and formed a U shape - nice and fresh.  Also decorating the drink was other stale old pickles and peppers - they were gross.  That's when I noticed my Bloody Mary was dark brown....I thought, okay, I'll try it anyway.  Not sure what that was, but nasty.  So contact with the server was not an option since she was nowhere to be found.  Spoke to bartender who became insulted and stated that all the Bloody Mary drinks have stout in them.  Realizing this is a beer bar, I stated that I did not actually want a beer drink and he ultimately replaced it - again after quite some time and fulfilling everyone else's drink requests he could possibly have fulfilled first.  The beer ordered in the beginning was at least cold but was the very last thing we ended up getting and the food was mediocre at best.  Could have overlooked many things here, but being treated like dirt is not one of them.

data.title: Local eatery
data.text: Recently had lunch at great basin,this is in old sparks near Victorian square.An older building but the food is good with   several choices on the menu.Sandwiches and burgers served with garlic fries.

data.title: Good Food and Drink and Close to Sparks Museum
data.text: This Brewpub is in a cute little area of Sparks with several restaurants and bars and the Sparks Museum.  I had a bratwurst sandwich which was delicious with a unique flavor.  Did not have the coarse grind which I dislike in bratwurst.  Drank Wild Horse Ale which I also recommend.  Huge menu, decent prices and good service.  Would definitely return

data.title: Best brews for lunch
data.text: Last week we had lunch at Great Basin.  What a selection of brews! I had a Hefeweisen, my husband had a porter.  Good food and brews at a reasonable cost.

data.title: Good lunch
data.text: There is a comprehensive menu and it is within walking distance of the Nuggett, where the food is lacking.

data.title: Craft Brew Mecca
data.text: Brewing on site provided plenty of craft brew options. Pints are $5. We ordered a wild horse cheddar sausage sandwich and a sweet Italian sandwich. Prompt friendly service. Excellent IPA and Porter beers. Reasonable prices.

data.title: Beer tasting before going to the movies
data.text:
We have had Great Basin beers many times... The milk Stout and IPa are very good.

We decided to check out their brew pub while visiting Sparks 

I think we tasted over ten beers. 

The atmosphere is a little older.. maybe it needs an update.

The beers were good and the service was fine. We didn't eat any food.

data.title: Tasty burgers and beer!
data.text:
Loved the patty melt burger as well as the chicken pasta dish! Yum!

Savouring these dishes with an Icky IPA and a Tectonic, made for a relaxing, satisfying family meal.

Made sure to pick up a case of Outlaw Stout next time I was in the grocery store.

data.title: Decent food and pretty good beer.
data.text: Friendly staff and pretty good beer. Live music. In the center of a bar /restaurant area suitable for walking.

data.title: Solo dinner
data.text: I walked over to the Great Basin Brewing Co. from the Nugget casino. It is a short walk. I had the charred chicken Caesar salad and it was delicious. The beer wasn't bad either!

data.title: Great Lunch!
data.text: My husband and I wanted a fun place for lunch that we could sit outside.  We had a great waiter, full of personality and actually seemed to really enjoy his job.  The menu is really wide.  Loads to choose from.  Would definitely go back the next time we are in Sparks.

data.title: Consistent Quality and Great Staff
data.text: I go to the Great Basin located in Reno mostly for work and I go to the Great Basin in Sparks mostly for fun because I live in Sparks. The food is consistent in both businesses and the staff has always been courteous and efficient. You don't just get "bar" food. One of my favorites is the honey jalapeno chicken salad and it consistently taste yummy. "Tightwad tuesdays" are always quite busy with the beer pints 2.50 all day long. The Sparks location frequently has live music. It's just a fun place to go regularly and comfortable to take my kids as well.

data.title: Great food, great staff
data.text: Everything I have eaten at this place (over several visit) has been good except for the bread pudding.  They have lots of different beers that sound good but I have not had any since I don't like beer.  Their three different sausages are great and made locally.  They have good fried fish in a beer batter.

data.title: Good eats and interesting beer collection
data.text: My husband and I went there a couple of weeks ago and loved the food (fish and chips are really great and fresh!) Great service, great beer selection,outside seating available. We will be back!

data.title: Great place!! Great Beer!!
data.text: This is a must to stop at place. Not only is the beer selection great but the food is fabulous. So try a little of everything. Get a flight of beer and some snacks.

data.title: Dinner and entertainment
data.text: A great brewery with lots of selections.Good food easy to find close to the freeway and never very busy sometimes they have live music also.

data.title: Best Brew Pub
data.text: My husband and I just ate supper and it was delicious! Service was very friendly and attentive. The beer was awesome, too! Highly recommend!

data.title: Choice brews and good daily specials
data.text:
Dinner time, the shepherd pie looks good, but the barley crusted Chicken parmigiano dinner special was looking good too. One of each and we'll share.
Good food and decent size helpings. The bread pudding was an excellent shared dessert.

data.title: Stuffed jalapeños to die for!
data.text:
We are in for a weekend visit and found Great Basin near our hotel.  When we arrived the short street had a variety of places to eat with an open air concert in session next to the restaurant.  We opted to bypass the nice patio for the quieter inside dining space. 

The menu and beer selection were ample for a brewpub. I selected the Shepherd's Pie. They didn't skimp on the chunks of lamb meat. The Steak Fajita Wrap was the size of a rolled up newspaper, however the amount steak was on the light side. Cucumber Salad is unique and enjoyed as well. 

We debated about getting the poppers, but SO glad we ordered the plate of open-faced version piled with cheese and bacon and lightly deep-fried. The Honey Jalepeno dipping sauce was the perfect companion, completing to heavenly appetizer experience. If you are a fan of this appy, you won't be disappointed! 

My beer choice was the Icky IPA, a nice cross of a British style with a touch of American revved up hops. The wheat beer was excellent as well.

The service was very good even on a Friday evening. Our waiter had a great sense of humor and we are glad he strongly recommend the poppers.
